title: Facebook Could Pay Roughly $6 Billion To Acquire Yelp - Nasdaq.com
text: Per Trefis estimates, Facebook ( FB  ) could potentially pay around $5.8 billion to acquire Yelp ( YELP  ) (a figure more than double its current market cap), and still be able to accrue billions of dollars in value for its own shareholders. We detail the rationale behind  Facebook potentially acquiring Yelp   in an interactive dashboard, along with our workings for the estimated acquisition price. Our estimate is based on the Yelp's intrinsic value and the value of revenue and cost synergies from an acquisition. Considering Yelp is much smaller than Facebook, most of the synergies are likely to arise from Yelp getting access to a larger user base at superior unit economics (EBITDA / user).
